content.div:
Being Kristen Stewart probably has its perks. She's on Forbes' list of the top 10 highest paid actresses, she gets to glower on the cover of every major fashion magazine, and her boyfriend and Twilight co-star Robert Pattinson is considered reasonably attractive in some circles.

But while some Hollywood wannabes might pray they were just like K-Stew -- wishing upon their Twilight Saga box sets for just a sparkly smidge of her fame -- Jennifer Lawrence is having none of it.

As 21-year-old Lawrence told Glamour UK: "I look at Kristen Stewart now and I think, 'I'd never want to be that famous.'" The Oscar nominee continued: "I can't imagine how I'd feel if all of a sudden my life was pandemonium."

It's right here that we'll remind you (and Lawrence) that the Kentucky-raised actress is the starring in upcoming adventure flick, The Hunger Games, one of the most anticipated movies of the year, a franchise-in-the-making based on Suzanne Collins' best-selling young adult novels.

She's also scheduled to take off on a Hunger Games mall tour March 3. Ask Stewart -- or anyone working a Twilight Hot Topic meet-and-greet: she's got about three days before she won't have to "imagine" pandemonium again. She'll be living the nightmare.

Lawrence realizes she could be on the edge of super-fame, though, and as she told Glamour: "I feel like I am in the eye of the hurricane right now. It's daunting. I feel like I got a ticket to another planet and I'm moving there and there's no turning back, and I don't know if I'm going to like that other planet or have friends there. It's just scary."

No friends? What about Stewart? You two are days from having oodles in common.

On the topic of Twilight's prettiest sad sack, Stewart and boyfriend Pattinson made a rare public appearance together over Oscar weekend. According to People, the couple took in a Grey Goose-sponsored Oscar pre-party. According to spies, they looked "quite affectionate." Reports suggest squealing and other instances of Stewart-induced pandemonium were kept to a minimum.

leahc@dose.ca

entry.title: Review Roundup: The Twilight Saga - Breaking Dawn, Part 1

link.Abstract: The Twilight movies are proving to be review-proof, but that has never stopped critics from baring their fangs. Read what they're saying about The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn, Part 1.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract:
Roger Ebert, Chicago Sun-Times:
Breaking Dawn - Part 1 is absorbing, if somewhat slow-paced, and has without doubt the most blood-curdling scene of live childbirth in a PG-13 movie...Kristen Stewart is really pretty good here, although like almost all actresses she believes pregnant women rub their baby bumps unceasingly. I would have liked more scenes developing her thoughts about married life.
link.title: Twilight Breaking Dawn, Part 1

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift's Speak Now World Tour is at its end. The country-pop star gave the first of two sold-out shows at New York's Madison Square Garden Nov. 21. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift at Madison Square Garden

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift always looks surprised in photos. But here's some news that really deserves an OMG-face: Swift was forced to cancel a series of concert dates due to bronchitis. Yikes! Get well soon, Swifty. It's time you built up your strength. Here, have a sandwich. In fact, have 10. We hope Swift's feeling better in time for her July 14 show in Montreal.
link.title: Gallery: Eat a Sandwich, Taylor Swift

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift has many faces, but they all look surprised.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift Looking Surprised

link.Abstract: Follow Dose.ca on Twitter
link.title: Follow Dose.ca on Twitter

entry.content: "Safe and Sound" is Taylor Swift's contribution to The Hunger Games soundtrack.

source.title: Jennifer Lawrence Doesn't Want to Be as Famous as Kristen Stewart
source.subtitle: Someone should probably tell her she's starring in the Hunger Games, then.
